Interface BufferString

All Known Implementing Classes:
CircularBufferString
public interface BufferString
Buffer interface specifies methods called by Master and Slave
Version:
1.0, 30 November 2021
Author:
Ben DeSollar

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.String[] blockingGet()
    return double array from Buffer
    void blockingPut​(java.lang.String[] array)
    place a String array into Buffer
    boolean getFinishedState()
    checks whether the slaves are done calculating the roots or not
    void setFinishedState​(boolean finishedState)
    sets whether the slaves are done calculating the roots or not

  • Method Details

    • blockingPut

      void blockingPut​(java.lang.String[] array) throws java.lang.InterruptedException
      place a String array into Buffer
      Parameters:
      array - a string array to store in the buffer
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - exception occurs if the thread has been interrupted

    • blockingGet

      java.lang.String[] blockingGet() throws java.lang.InterruptedException
      return double array from Buffer
      Returns:
      a double array from Buffer
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - exception occurs if the thread has been interrupted

    • getFinishedState

      boolean getFinishedState()
      checks whether the slaves are done calculating the roots or not
      Returns:
      true or false depending on if the slaves are done calculating the roots

    • setFinishedState

      void setFinishedState​(boolean finishedState)
      sets whether the slaves are done calculating the roots or not
      Parameters:
      finishedState - true or false depending on if the slaves are done calculating the roots
